answer: The Chevrolet Silverado 1500 offers a compelling user experience with a combination of power, performance, design, technology, and safety features. It provides four powerful engine options, allowing drivers to tailor the truck's performance to their specific needs. The Silverado 1500 boasts impressive towing and off-roading capabilities, making it versatile for various tasks. The 2025 model includes advanced trailering technology with up to eight available cameras offering 14 different views, enhancing the towing experience. For added convenience, some models feature Super Cruise, a hands-free driver assistance system that manages speed and steering, even while towing. The Silverado 1500 also offers a range of trim levels, including the off-road-focused ZR2, catering to different preferences and use cases. Overall, users can expect a well-rounded truck that combines practicality, advanced technology, and robust performance in various driving conditions.

MODEL REVIEW
Chevrolet Silverado 1500 Review

Chevrolet Silverado 1500 at a Glance

You're in the market for a new pickup truck for many reasons. You may need to tow equipment to the job site, haul supplies for a home project, or head off-road to a remote campsite. Maybe you just want to enjoy every moment behind the wheel while cruising around Livonia, Redford, Wayne, MI.
Whatever your plan, having a pickup that blends brawn and brains is key. Enter the Chevrolet Silverado 1500. Ready to learn more? The Feldman Chevrolet of Livonia team has crafted this review to showcase how this versatile truck is as smart as strong.
MAX HORSEPOWER
420 HP
MAX TOWING CAPACITY
13,300 lbs.
PAYLOAD
2,260 lbs.
ENGINE OPTIONS
4
HANDS-FREE HIGHWAY TRAVEL
Available
12 TIE-DOWNS
Standard
MULTI-FLEX TAILGATE
Available
Chevrolet Silverado 1500: The Perfect Blend of Brawn and Brains
Explore the categories below to discover more about the features of the Chevrolet Silverado 1500.
PERFORMANCE
VIEW INFO
DESIGN
VIEW INFO
TECHNOLOGY
VIEW INFO
PERFORMANCE
Your truck needs a powertrain that delivers. Whether towing cargo or heading off-road, a capable engine ensures your pickup handles business or adventure with ease.
1 Truck, 4 Engines
The Chevrolet Silverado 1500 offers four powerful engines, allowing you to tailor your truck's performance to your needs. You can choose the right power output from the 3.0L Duramax® Turbo Diesel to the impressive 6.2L EcoTec3 V8 for your daily grind or weekend adventures.
? ? ? ? ? ? ? ???????? ???????? ???????? ? ? ???????? ???????? ???????? ? ? ? ???????? ???????? ???????? ? ???????? ???????? ???????? ?
| 
Engine
| 
Horsepower
| 
Torque
|
| --- | --- | --- |
| 3.0L Duramax® Turbo Diesel | 305 HP | 495 lb-ft |
| TurboMax™ (standard) | 310 HP | 430 lb-ft |
| 5.3L EcoTec3 V8 | 355 HP | 383 lb-ft |
| 6.2L EcoTec3 V8 | 420 HP | 460 lb-ft |
Every engine is paired with an 8-speed automatic transmission that delivers power and control. For drivers seeking even more performance, the available 10-speed automatic transmission further enhances capability and smooth driving experience. No matter your choice, the Silverado 1500 equips you with the power to face whatever the day brings.
The Power Principle
The Chevrolet Silverado 1500 is ready to take you anywhere with nearly anything, thanks to its impressive towing and off-roading capabilities. When properly equipped, the Silverado 1500 can tow up to 13,300 pounds, making it possible to haul items like:
***   Horse or Livestock Trailer
*   Dump Trailer
*   25-foot Boat
*   35-foot Travel Trailer
*   5th Wheel Camper**
When the workday ends, the Silverado 1500 is ready for off-road adventures. Trims like the ZR2, LT Trail Boss, and Custom Trail Boss are built to tackle tough terrain, giving you the freedom to explore rugged paths.
Whether towing or exploring the great unknown, there are features to help. Tow/Haul mode optimizes shift points, while 4-wheel drive enhances traction on gravel, mud, and sand. With the Silverado 1500, you can handle heavy lifting and still confidently hit the trails.
▲ BACK TO CATEGORIES ▲
DESIGN
The Chevrolet Silverado 1500 gives you the power of choice. From exterior colors to cab sizes, there are plenty of ways you can make the Silverado 1500 truly your Silverado 1500.
Thinking Inside the (Cargo) Box
The Silverado 1500’s Durabed means business—whether you're hauling gear for work or pleasure. Crafted from high-strength steel, it features 12 standard tie-downs and boasts a best-in-class cargo volume of 89.1 cubic feet, providing ample space for camping gear, DIY materials, and more.
Loading and unloading is a breeze, thanks to the available 6-function Multi-Flex Tailgate. This versatile tailgate adapts to your needs, offering configurations like:
***   Primary Gate
*   Primary Gate Load Stop
*   Easy Access
*   Full-Width Step
*   Inner Gate Load Stop
*   Inner Gate with Work Surface**
With the Multi-Flex Tailgate, the Silverado 1500 showcases its versatility and strength. Which function will you try first?
Superior Interior
Step inside the Silverado 1500 to find a cabin designed for comfort and versatility. Imagine starting a weekend camping trip, settling into available heated or perforated leather seats while the optional heated steering wheel warms your hands on chilly drives.
With three cab sizes, the Regular Cab seats three, while the spacious Double Cab and Crew Cab accommodate six—perfect for friends or coworkers.
The 40/20/40 split-bench front seat offers under-seat storage for tools or snacks, while the 60/40 split-folding rear bench lets you carry larger items, whether it’s lumber for a project or extra camping gear. In the Silverado 1500, every drive becomes an enjoyable experience, whether for work or play.
▲ BACK TO CATEGORIES ▲
TECHNOLOGY
Whether you're staying connected with your crew at the job site or friends at the campsite, the Silverado 1500 ensures you have the tech to remain in touch. All essential features are conveniently located at your fingertips.
Infotainment Central
Want to find out how a job's progressing or connect with the family when you’re on the road? You can easily do so through the standard Chevrolet Infotainment 3 System that includes:
***   7-inch touchscreen (13.4-inch screen available)
*   Bluetooth®
*   Wireless Apple CarPlay™ and Android Auto™
*   Wi-Fi® hotspot capable
*   Voice command**
Every trip, whether for work or pleasure, deserves its own soundtrack. The available Bose® Premium Sound System will enhance your preferred on- or off-road playlist. Seven expertly crafted speakers are strategically placed throughout the cabin, offering high-quality audio to make you think you’ve scored front-row tickets to your favorite band.
Trailering Tech: Safety Comes Standard
Of course, when you’re behind the wheel, the most important technologies are those that help keep you safe. The Silverado 1500 provides plenty of protection with its standard Chevrolet Safety Assist, which includes features like Automatic Emergency Braking, Lane Keep Assist with Lane Departure Warning, and more.
As you know, towing involves much more than hitching up a trailer and going. That’s why Chevrolet offers a variety of available driver-assistance systems. Among them are Trailer Side Blind Zone Alert, cameras with up to 14 views, and the Trailering App, which includes pre-departure checklists, tire pressure monitoring, and more.
Once you’ve hit the highway, Super Cruise™ hands-free driving is available on over 400,000 miles of compatible roads and handles speed and steering, even with a trailer attached, when those miles have taken their toll.
▲ BACK TO CATEGORIES ▲
Chevrolet Silverado 1500 vs. The Competition
At a Glance: Chevrolet Silverado 1500 vs. Ford F-150

The Chevrolet Silverado 1500 stands out against the Ford F-150, showcasing superior intelligence and toughness. The Silverado truly elevates functionality with its innovative Multi-Flex Tailgate and more hands-free-compatible routes. It's ready to lead the way!
Quick Facts
| 
Silverado 1500
| 
vs
| 
F-150
|
| --- | --- | --- |
| 430 lb-ft | STANDARD TORQUE | 400 lb-ft |
| 6 | TAILGATE FUNCTIONS | 3 |
| 400,000 miles | HANDS-FREE DRIVING ROADS | 130,000 miles |
At a Glance: Chevrolet Silverado 1500 vs. Ram 1500

Each pickup truck has unique strengths in the competition between the Chevrolet Silverado and Ram 1500. Both trucks deliver whether you need impressive towing capabilities or the latest innovations. However, key differences set them apart. Which one will best meet your needs?
Quick Facts
| 
Silverado 1500
| 
vs
| 
Ram 1500
|
| --- | --- | --- |
| 13,300 lbs. | MAX TOWING | 11,550 lbs. |
| Available | HANDS-FREE DRIVING WITH TRAILER | Not Offered |
| 13.4 in. | MAX TOUCHSCREEN SIZE | 12 in. |
At a Glance: Chevrolet Silverado 1500 vs. Toyota Tundra

Deciding between the Chevrolet Silverado 1500 and the Toyota Tundra is an exciting choice. Both pickups are powerful, feature-rich, and stylish. Ultimately, the Silverado 1500 excels in performance, delivering the capabilities you need for any adventure.
Quick Facts

Silverado 1500
| 
vs
| 
Tundra
|
| --- | --- | --- |
| 14 | MAX TRAILER CAMERA VIEWS | 1 |
| 2,260 lbs. | MAX PAYLOAD | 1,940 lbs. |
| Available | GOOGLE ASSISTANT | Not Offered |
Test Drive the Strong and Smart Silverado 1500
As you’ve seen, the Chevrolet Silverado 1500 is a well-balanced vehicle, equally adept in brawn and brain. Ready to get behind the wheel of this intelligent powerhouse? Drivers in Livonia, Redford, Wayne, MI can contact the team at Feldman Chevrolet of Livonia to schedule a test drive of the Silverado 1500 today!
All of the tools you need to move forward with experiencing a new Chevrolet Silverado 1500 for yourself are conveniently available right here online.
Step into a New Chevrolet Silverado 1500
Explore our extensive new inventory, receive an estimate on your trade-in, apply for credit or contact us to schedule your in-person test drive using the quick links here.

2019 Chevrolet Silverado Model Review in Amory, MS
The new 2019 Chevrolet Silverado is the strongest, most advanced Silverado ever. The Chevrolet Silverado is completely brand new for 2019 and features powerful engine options with up to 420 horsepower, 6 advanced powertrains, available advanced trailering technology, and more. It’s easy to see why more people prefer the Silverado over any other full-size pickup truck! See what the Silverado 1500 has to offer and visit Larry Clark Chevrolet for a test drive!
View Inventory
 

Which 2019 Silverado 1500 Model is Right for Me?
A Hardworking Durabed in the Silverado 1500
Towing Capabilities and Technology
Shop the New 2019 Silverado 1500 at Larry Clark Chevrolet in Amory, MS

Which 2019 Silverado 1500 Model is Right for Me?
The Chevrolet Silverado 1500 comes in eight distinct trims with unique designs and capabilities. It’s easy to find the model that’s right for your needs:
• Work Truck
• Custom
• Custom Trail Boss
• LT
• RST
• LT Trail Boss
• LTZ
• High County
If you are looking for a basic Silverado, check out the Work Truck, which features the new innovative tie downs in the Durabed and an Ecotec 4.3L V6 engine with Active Fuel Management. A great middle of the road pickup truck is the Silverado LT with its LED headlamps, 17-inch wheels, and 8-inch color touchscreen. The most luxurious pickup truck is the Silverado 1500 High Country, which features the industry first power up/down tailgate, as well as 20-inch machined-aluminum wheels.
 
A Hardworking Durabed in the Silverado 1500
The 2019 Silverado 1500 features an all-new bed that’s redesigned to be lighter, larger, and stronger than its predecessors. Durabed combines high-strength roll-formed steel, more cargo volume than any other truck, and 12 standard tie downs, which is three more than any other competitor. Along with an available industry-first power up/down tailgate, it’s the most functional bed of any pickup. The all-new design offers:
• Up to 20% more cargo volume than the competition.
• Best-in-class bed width
• Best-in-class bed length for standard and short box
• Offers more cargo volume in the short box than the competitions standard box.
 
Towing Capabilities and Technology
The Silverado 1500 was designed with advanced trailering technology, so you can stay confident and in control. The in-vehicle trailering technology includes a service reminder, trailering profiles, and pre-departure checklist, so you can make sure everything is secure before hitting the open road. Other trailering technologies include tow/haul reminders and trailer theft alert. The rear trailer camera, side view cameras, electronic parking brake hookup assist, and hitch guidance with hitch view play a vital role in helping you tow and haul heavy loads.
 
Shop the New 2019 Silverado 1500 at Larry Clark Chevrolet in Amory, MS
We know our customers depend on heavy-duty pickup trucks for work and play. At Larry Clark Chevrolet, you can shop the latest Silverado 1500 near Amory, MS. Browse our extensive inventory online and contact us to schedule a test drive!

results.content: ![Image 87: Side view of a 2025 Chevrolet Silverado LD ZR2 in Riptide Blue up a mountain](https://www.chevrolet.com/content/dam/chevrolet/na/us/english/index/vehicles/2025/trucks/silverado-ld/mov/02-images/mh/2025-ldretail-mh-01-v2.jpg?imwidth=960) With proven trailering technology and eight available cameras offering up to 14 views,* Silverado provides everything you need for a long day of towing. Available on Silverado LT, RST, LT Trail Boss, LTZ, ZR2 and High Country. Available on High Country, Super Cruise®* connected by OnStar offers hands-free driver assistance, managing speed and steering to keep you refreshed during your adventures — even while towing. ![Image 117: Front Grille of a Blue 2025 Chevy Silverado on a Muddy Road](https://www.chevrolet.com/content/dam/chevrolet/na/us/english/index/vehicles/2025/trucks/silverado-ld/mov/02-images/zr2/2025-ldretail-zr2-02v2.jpg?imwidth=1200) ![Image 121: Three Quarters View of a 2025 Grey Chevy Silverado In a Garage](https://www.chevrolet.com/content/dam/chevrolet/na/us/english/index/vehicles/2025/trucks/silverado-ld/mov/02-images/special-editions/2025-ldretail-specialeditions-02-v3.jpg?imwidth=1200) [![Image 138: Front Passenger Seat View of the Interior of Chevy 2025 Silverado with its Door Open](https://www.chevrolet.com/content/dam/chevrolet/na/us/english/index/vehicles/2025/trucks/silverado-ld/mov/01-images/2025-ldretail-gallerypre-01.jpg?imwidth=1200)](https://www.chevrolet.com/trucks/silverado/1500# "Gallery Preview")

Performance
Ready, steady and strong
At the heart of every Silverado lies a capable engine that uses the latest advanced technology to deliver impactful performance. Offering four powerful engine choices – including the only diesel in its class*, Duramax 3.0L Turbo-Diesel – Silverado delivers strength, dependability and a hefty payload.
     ![Image 107: Close-up of a Chevy Silverado Engine](https://www.chevrolet.com/content/dam/chevrolet/na/us/english/index/vehicles/2025/trucks/silverado-ld/mov/01-images/2025-ldretail-performance-1.png?imwidth=1200)   ![Image 108: Close-up of a Chevy Silverado Engine](https://www.chevrolet.com/content/dam/chevrolet/na/us/english/index/vehicles/2025/trucks/silverado-ld/mov/01-images/2025-ldretail-performance-2.png?imwidth=1200)


TurboMax™

Equipped with Dynamic Fuel Management and Automatic Stop/Start

Equipped with Automatic Stop/Start
TurboMax™
Standard on WT, Custom, Custom Trail Boss, LT, RST and LT Trail Boss

310 horsepower
Best-in-class 430 lb.-ft. of torque*
8-speed automatic transmission

5.3L EcoTec3 V8

Engine Details
See Inside TurboMax
Towing & Trailering  

Towing tenacity
With proven trailering technology and eight available cameras offering up to 14 views,* Silverado provides everything you need for a long day of towing. Plus, the available Trailering App offers customized trailer profiles, pre-departure checklists and trailer tire pressure/temperature monitoring.*
Chevy Truck Talks: What can my Silverado tow?

Camera views
Trailering safety
Trailering app

Camera views
Up to 14 Available Camera Views*
From hitching to driving to parking, Silverado offers advanced camera technologies that are designed to help make your towing job easier from start to finish. Available on Silverado LT, RST, LT Trail Boss, LTZ, ZR2 and High Country.
Camera Technologies
Trailering safety
Trailer Side Blind Zone Alert*
Trailer Side Blind Zone Alert enables visual side-mirror alerts when a moving vehicle is detected in the side blind zone.
Trailering tech
Trailering app
Trailering app
Whether you’re in it for the long haul or the short, you can create a custom trailer profile to help you easily set up and monitor your connected trailer.
Towing and Trailering
Advanced technology  

Super Cruise hands-free driving
Available on High Country, Super Cruise®* connected by OnStar offers hands-free driver assistance, managing speed and steering to keep you refreshed during your adventures — even while towing. On average, Super Cruise users drive more than 10 million hands-free miles per month total.
Super Cruise
Super Cruise with Trailering*
Allows you to tow your heavy load hands-free. No other competitor offers a hands-free driving system with towing capability.*
Automatic comfort and convenience
Automatically adjusts the gap between you and the vehicle ahead for extra stopping distance.

Turn on
Activate Super Cruise when the white Super Cruise icon appears on the instrument cluster.   
Lights on
When the Super Cruise symbol and steering wheel indicator turn green, you’re ready to go hands-free.   
Hands off
Let go and enjoy one of the largest hands-free driving networks in North America   
Interior  

Inside ingenuity
Advanced interior technology puts infotainment at your fingertips and can even turn your Silverado into a mobile office with standard Wi-Fi®* hotspot capability — keeping you connected almost anywhere the day takes you.
13.4-inch diagonal
touch-screen
Available
12.3-inch diagonal Driver Information Center
Available
Wireless Apple CarPlay®* and Android Auto™*
Compatibility

Chevrolet with Google built-in
Enjoy an enhanced in-vehicle experience with available Google built-in* compatibility, which includes Google Assistant to call/text friends, set reminders or control temperature, and Google Maps to help navigate — all from your center display.
Google built-in 
Connected Services*
Available OnStar®* provides a variety of entertainment and convenience features — including 24/7 access to live OnStar Advisors, on-demand vehicle diagnostics, In-Vehicle Apps and more.
Connected Services 
ZR2  

Four wheels, no roads
Silverado ZR2 is most at home when it goes off-road. Outfitted with a long list of performance and capability features, ZR2 has what it takes to tame any trail.
Multimatic DSSV™ dampers
33-inch Goodyear Wrangler Territory® MT tires
2-inch factory-installed lift
  ![Image 117: Front Grille of a Blue 2025 Chevy Silverado on a Muddy Road](https://www.chevrolet.com/content/dam/chevrolet/na/us/english/index/vehicles/2025/trucks/silverado-ld/mov/02-images/zr2/2025-ldretail-zr2-02v2.jpg?imwidth=1200)


ZR2 Features

2-inch factory-installed lift
Multimatic DSSV™ dampers
Off-road cut front bumper enables 33.5-degree approach angle
Front and rear electronic locking differentials

Large underbody aluminum skid plates


33-inch Goodyear Wrangler Territory® MT tires with ZR2-specific 18-inch aluminum wheels

Black chrome grille with Chevy flowtie badge
Exclusive ZR2 interior with 13.4-inch diagonal infotainment touch-screen and 12.3-inch Driver Information Center

Build & Buy
ZR2 Features   High Country

Whatever you’ve been working toward, Silverado High Country is the reward. 
13.4-inch diagonal touch-screen
Standard

  ![Image 121: Three Quarters View of a 2025 Grey Chevy Silverado In a Garage](https://www.chevrolet.com/content/dam/chevrolet/na/us/english/index/vehicles/2025/trucks/silverado-ld/mov/02-images/special-editions/2025-ldretail-specialeditions-02-v3.jpg?imwidth=1200)


Special Editions  

Signature styles
Our lineup of special editions, including the ZR2 Bison Edition, offers you choices when it comes to finding the right combination of distinctive looks and gritty capability to suit your personal style.   
ZR2 Bison Edition  

We set out with AEV to build a beast of an off-road truck so you can tackle wild terrain like never before.  

Available on Silverado ZR2
AEV Bison unique front and rear differentials, transfer case and fuel tank skid plates
AEV Bison front and rear bumpers
Black vertical front tow hooks*
Body-color grille bar
Gloss Black 18-inch AEV unique wheels
Multi-Flex Tailgate with unique Black finish
AEV-branded floor liners and head restraints
AEV bed side outer decal


Redline Edition  

With head-turning Red and Black accents, Redline Edition* ensures your Silverado stands out in any crowd. Available on RST.

20-inch high-gloss Black-painted aluminum wheels with Red accents
Dual exhaust outlets with Black rectangular tips
Black RST and Silverado emblems with Red outline on fender and tailgate
Red striping on rearview mirrors
High-intensity discharge LED headlamps with Black bezels
Red recovery hooks*
High-gloss Black door handles
Black tubular assist steps   

Midnight Edition  

Dramatically designed to command attention, Silverado Midnight Edition* also provides a 2-inch factory suspension lift with the Z71 Off-Road Package. Available on Custom Trail Boss, LT Trail Boss and High Country models.

Black appearance with Black badging, recovery hooks,* bed decal, bumpers, dual rectangular exhaust tips and grille
High-gloss Black-painted aluminum wheels and all-terrain blackwall tires
High-intensity discharge LED headlamps with Black bezels on LT Trail Boss and High Country
Black power-retractable assist steps (High Country only)   

TurboMax™ Blackout Edition  

With its dark demeanor, the Silverado TurboMax Blackout Package shines with blacked-out features and bold style.

Dark Essentials Package, including Silverado nameplates, Custom and TurboMax badges, bowtie, and tailgate lettering all in Black
4-inch round Black assist steps
Black Chrome exhaust tip
20-inch high-gloss Black-painted wheels   

Rally Edition  

With looks this bold, the street is its showroom. Silverado Rally Edition* is available on Custom and RST models. 

Black hood and tailgate rally stripes
Black badging, bowtie emblems and tailgate lettering and Black exhaust tip(s)
20-inch high-gloss Black-painted aluminum wheels
Available 22-inch high-gloss Black-painted aluminum wheels*
Black tubular assist steps

All Special Editions
Durabed & Multi-Flex Tailgate
At the forefront of functionality
12
Standard tie-downs
89.1 cu. ft.*
Best-in-class* cargo volume
120-volt
Outlet (available)
Power-up/-down tailgate
Available

A strong fit
With a flexible 89.1 cu. ft.* of best-in-class standard cargo volume at your service, you’ll have no problem transporting larger, bulky items like:

furniture
camping and recreational gear
household appliances
landscaping materials
lumber and building supplies

Six ways to Multi-Flex
The available Multi-Flex Tailgate offers six different functions to help improve loading, unloading and accessing the cargo bed.

Primary gate
Opens from the key fob, a switch inside the truck or a button on the gate.

Primary gate load stop
Helps prevent extra-long items from sliding out of the bed.

Easy access
The inner gate folds down, allowing you to reach farther into the bed.

Full-width step
The inner gate folds down into a large step for easy access, capable of holding up to 375 lbs.*

Inner gate load stop
Helps prevent second-tier items from sliding out of the bed.

Inner gate with work surface
When opened, provides a place for a laptop or blueprints, as well as second-tier loading.

Safety Features
Safety or driver assistance features are no substitute for the driver’s responsibility to operate the vehicle in a safe manner. The driver should remain attentive to traffic, surroundings and road conditions at all times. Visibility, weather and road conditions may affect feature performance. Read the vehicle Owner’s Manual for more important feature limitations and information.

The latter is a minor thing. I guess the first is too, except it's one of those things you get used to having and then miss it when it's gone.

#9

I own a level 2 TRX and a '22 f350 KR and the '24 ZR2 so I have a pretty good feel for all 3 makes. I think the Ford has the most comfortable interior, the TRX has the best looking and the chevy has the most functional and user friendly.  
I see where the ZR2 could improve the colors and some of the materials, but for the type pickup it is I think it's fine. we have about 3k miles on it now and I would buy it again.
